    GetRepackedAttachments(List<Attachment>, List<Attachment>, Material, out Material, out Texture2D, Int32, Int32, TextureFormat, Boolean, String, Boolean, Boolean)

    Fills the outputAttachments list with new attachment objects based on the attachments in sourceAttachments, but mapped to a new single texture using the same material.

    Declaration
    public static void GetRepackedAttachments(List<Attachment> sourceAttachments, List<Attachment> outputAttachments, Material materialPropertySource, out Material outputMaterial, out Texture2D outputTexture, int maxAtlasSize = 1024, int padding = 2, TextureFormat textureFormat = TextureFormat.RGBA32, bool mipmaps = false, string newAssetName = "Repacked Attachments", bool clearCache = false, bool useOriginalNonrenderables = true)
    Parameters
    Type Name Description
    List<Attachment> sourceAttachments

    The list of attachments to be repacked.
    List<Attachment> outputAttachments

    The List(Attachment) to populate with the newly created Attachment objects.
    UnityEngine.Material materialPropertySource

    May be null. If no Material property source is provided, no special

    UnityEngine.Material outputMaterial
    UnityEngine.Texture2D outputTexture
    Int32 maxAtlasSize
    Int32 padding
    UnityEngine.TextureFormat textureFormat
    Boolean mipmaps
    String newAssetName
    Boolean clearCache
    Boolean useOriginalNonrenderables
    | Improve this Doc View Source

    GetRepackedSkin(Skin, String, Material, out Material, out Texture2D, Int32, Int32, TextureFormat, Boolean, Boolean)

    Creates and populates a duplicate skin with cloned attachments that are backed by a new packed texture atlas comprised of all the regions from the original skin.

    Declaration
    public static Skin GetRepackedSkin(this Skin o, string newName, Material materialPropertySource, out Material outputMaterial, out Texture2D outputTexture, int maxAtlasSize = 1024, int padding = 2, TextureFormat textureFormat = TextureFormat.RGBA32, bool mipmaps = false, bool useOriginalNonrenderables = true)
    Parameters
    Type Name Description
    Skin o
    String newName
    UnityEngine.Material materialPropertySource
    UnityEngine.Material outputMaterial
    UnityEngine.Texture2D outputTexture
    Int32 maxAtlasSize
    Int32 padding
    UnityEngine.TextureFormat textureFormat
    Boolean mipmaps
    Boolean useOriginalNonrenderables
    Returns
    Type Description
    Skin
    Remarks

    GetRepackedSkin is an expensive operation, preferably call it at level load time. No Spine.Atlas object is created so there is no way to find AtlasRegions except through the Attachments using them.

    | Improve this Doc View Source

    GetRepackedSkin(Skin, String, Shader, out Material, out Texture2D, Int32, Int32, TextureFormat, Boolean, Material, Boolean, Boolean)

    Creates and populates a duplicate skin with cloned attachments that are backed by a new packed texture atlas comprised of all the regions from the original skin.

    Declaration
    public static Skin GetRepackedSkin(this Skin o, string newName, Shader shader, out Material outputMaterial, out Texture2D outputTexture, int maxAtlasSize = 1024, int padding = 2, TextureFormat textureFormat = TextureFormat.RGBA32, bool mipmaps = false, Material materialPropertySource = null, bool clearCache = false, bool useOriginalNonrenderables = true)
    Parameters
    Type Name Description
    Skin o
    String newName
    UnityEngine.Shader shader
    UnityEngine.Material outputMaterial
    UnityEngine.Texture2D outputTexture
    Int32 maxAtlasSize
    Int32 padding
    UnityEngine.TextureFormat textureFormat
    Boolean mipmaps
    UnityEngine.Material materialPropertySource
    Boolean clearCache
    Boolean useOriginalNonrenderables
    Returns
    Type Description
    Skin
    Remarks

    GetRepackedSkin is an expensive operation, preferably call it at level load time. No Spine.Atlas object is created so there is no way to find AtlasRegions except through the Attachments using them.

    | Improve this Doc View Source

    ToAtlasRegion(Sprite, Material)

    Creates a Spine.AtlasRegion from a UnityEngine.Sprite. This creates a new AtlasPage object for every AtlasRegion you create. You can centralize Material control by creating a shared atlas page using Material.ToSpineAtlasPage and using the sprite.ToAtlasRegion(AtlasPage) overload.

    Declaration
    public static AtlasRegion ToAtlasRegion(this Sprite s, Material material)
    Parameters
    Type Name Description
    UnityEngine.Sprite s
    UnityEngine.Material material
    Returns
    Type Description
    AtlasRegion
    | Improve this Doc View Source

    ToSpineAtlasPage(Material)

    Creates a new Spine.AtlasPage from a UnityEngine.Material. If the material has a preassigned texture, the page width and height will be set.

    ToTexture(AtlasRegion, TextureFormat, Boolean)

    Creates a new Texture2D object based on an AtlasRegion. If applyImmediately is true, Texture2D.Apply is called immediately after the Texture2D is filled with data.

    Declaration
    public static Texture2D ToTexture(this AtlasRegion ar, TextureFormat textureFormat = TextureFormat.RGBA32, bool mipmaps = false)
    Parameters
    Type Name Description
    AtlasRegion ar
    UnityEngine.TextureFormat textureFormat
    Boolean mipmaps
    Returns
    Type Description
    UnityEngine.Texture2D
